title: [Large-Scale] Strengthening 21st-Century Citizenship Competencies Through Maker Education: Self-Assessment Design Within Social Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic maker activities, digital tool proficiency, understanding of social interaction and civic rights, and introductory project management concepts
context.additional_context: Applies gamification and personalized learning design in project-based assessments, fostering civic awareness and community connectivity. The curriculum includes maker activities reflecting historical/geographical contexts, exploring intercultural collaboration and institutional support mechanisms.

learning_goals: During maker projects, learners regularly self-assess 21st-century citizen competencies (creativity, collaboration, critical thinking) within the context of civic rights and social relationships.

Using gamification elements (level-ups, badges, point rewards), learners write competency development plans ≥3 times weekly for two weeks, submit reflection journals incorporating ≥2 peer feedbacks, and devise community problem-solving solutions applying intercultural collaboration strategies.

Learners select one of two fields (woodworking or 3D modeling) for a 3-week period, set individual maker learning goals, create a weekly plan including activities, time spent, and resource lists, achieve at least 80% of the weekly checklist, and submit a final prototype or report evaluated on three criteria (creativity, feasibility, completeness) with at least two criteria rated as "Average" (Grade B) or higher. Additionally, in a 5-minute presentation, they must concretely propose solutions linked to community issues (e.g., recycling resource utilization, public space improvement) considering historical and geographical contexts.

resources: Maker kit (3D pen, simple electronic components, etc.)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
